Class SimilarityUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • SimilarityUtil

  • public class SimilarityUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    The class SimilarityUtil contains functions directly related to aiding the calculation the similarity between words.
    Since:
    26-04-2019
    Author:
    Luke Byrne, Lilian Morgan, Heather Lloyd

      findMeanOfSimilarities() takes in a list of an assumed correct input of 3 vectors, and calculates the mean similarities between the three "similarity lists" which were created with the previous function, findAllSimilarities().

    • Method Detail

      • findAllSimilarities

        private static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> findAllSimilarities(Vector v,
                                                                                    VectorList list)
        The method findAllSimilarities() finds *all* the similarities between the input vector and all the vectors within the VectorList. This is just one word's similarities calculated at a time.
        Parameters:
        v - = vector/word whose similarities is being calculate
        list - = the list of vectors against which the similarities are being calculated
        Returns:
        similarities = the mapping of each word in the VectorList and its corresponding similarity to the input word
        Since:
        26-04-2019

      • findMeanOfSimilarities

        private static java.util.Map<java.lang.Double,java.lang.String> findMeanOfSimilarities(Vector[] vecs,
                                                                                       VectorList list)
        findMeanOfSimilarities() takes in a list of an assumed correct input of 3 vectors, and calculates the mean similarities between the three "similarity lists" which were created with the previous function, findAllSimilarities(). This gets a mean similarity between all three words.
        Parameters:
        vecs - = the vectors whose similarities are being averaged,
        list - = the vector list against whom the similarities are being calculated
        Returns:
        similarityMeans = the mean similarity list, which contains every word in the VectorList and its corresponding mean similarity to the three input word. *NOTE*: the key/value pair has been inversed in the return, for ease of use for the third and final similarityUtil function
        Since:
        26-04-2019

      • findClosestSimilarities

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.Double,java.lang.String> findClosestSimilarities(Vector[] vecs,
                                                                                       VectorList list,
                                                                                       int k)
        findClosestSimilarities() is the only public and usable method, and uses the two previous functions to achieve this goal. It once again takes in as input the three "guesses" vectors, and the VectorList. Its primary goal is to organise the mean similarities by ascending order, and then take the top 10 similarities in a relatively easy manner as they're sorted by the TreeMap! The only constraint is that it will skip over a word, if it appears in the top 10 similarities, if it is indeed one of the three guesses.
        Parameters:
        vecs - = the guesses, VectorList = the list of words and their vectors
        list - = the list from which the vectors come
        k - = the number of closest similarities we must find
        Returns:
        the mapping of the k closest similarities
        Since:
        26-04-2019

      • meanOf3

        static double meanOf3(double a,
                      double b,
                      double c)
        meanOf3 is a very simple function for, indeed, finding the mean of three numbers (double, in this case)
        Parameters:
        a - = number 1
        b - = number 2
        c - = number 3
        Returns:
        the mean of the three numbers, (a + b + c) / 3
        Since:
        26-04-2019
